main_definition: A regular, systematic activity of monitoring or supervising an area to ensure safety, security, or compliance with rules.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To watch over and monitor a specific area regularly for safety or crime prevention
meanings_and_examples.example: The police officer patrolled the neighborhood looking out for any suspicious activity.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A scheduled route that officers, guards, or military personnel follow to maintain order or enforce regulations
meanings_and_examples.example: The soldiers went on a nightly patrol of their assigned sector in the city.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To check or inspect something regularly as part of maintenance or quality control
meanings_and_examples.example: The factory had regular patrols to ensure all equipment was functioning properly and safely.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A group of people assigned to monitor a specific area for safety or regulatory compliance
meanings_and_examples.example: The security team conducted their weekly patrol around the perimeter of the construction site.
